sub_title: Searching for a New Challenge or Opportunity
summary: A PMP-certified, trained and experienced project lead/manager with diverse fundamental technical knowledge and skills in area of computers, electronic/electrical, embedded and control systems, and biotechnology/analysis. Also equipped with broad knowledge in people-management, organizational change and risk management, processes, coordination, and socio-multi-cultural skills. Equipped with experiences that enables me to provide an acceptable framework and environment to negotiate with, align with, support, motivate, influence without power, and work collectively with people/stakeholders from diverse disciplines and cultures while independently contributing to the common objective of a team and company involved.

projects.title: YieldStar (YS) OPerational EXpense (OPEX) Responsibility Transfer to ASML's Local Sites
projects.description: My main task includes drawing to a close on-going conference calls with several ASML local sites on the performance of the YS machines with the goal of ensuring local sites' engineers and coordinators completely take responsibility for the effective performance monitoring of YS machines at ASML's customers' locations. ASML local sites concluded so far included several from/in Taiwan, United States, Europe. Other on-going sites includes those in China, Europe, United States, Japan.

projects.title: Several On-going LCP Installations at Several ASML customer (Europe, US, Asia) Locations
projects.description: Similar to the second LCP at Hynix in South Korea, my task includes coordinating the several installs, ensuring that the install location meets the requirements, and that ASML local sites have the right people and resources available for a successful install. This will involve interacting with several parties in ASML both in Netherlands and abroad. Currently an average of 7 LCP installs are on-going/scheduled in the next couples of weeks at Samsung and Micron (United States), Japan, ST France, TSMC (Taiwan, 3 installs) and more to come.

projects.title: Second Litho Computing Platform (LCP) Installation at Hynix, South Korea
projects.description: My task involved coordinating this install from Veldhoven Netherlands. First I volunteered to play temporal role of a PL to coordinate all parties involved in the install before a new PL was assigned 2-weeks later. A second and main responsibility was to ensure that the location at customer site for the LCP server meets all requirements before installation. I was also responsible for making sure ASML local site in Korea have the right set of people and resources to make the install successful.

profile_positions.title: Project Lead for Customers' Site Support (Full Service Premium)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible as project coordinator for providing onsite/remote support and coordination (as well as issue escalation management) during introduction of new ASML systems and upgrade of existing systems at several ASML customer locations worldwide.

(Project) Activities Include:

August 2016 - Date:
Project coordinator for the Full Service Premium product for several ASML customers. Responsible for coordinating roll-out, safety stock level plannings & maintaining gap analysis overview towards ASML GLS department.

August 2015 – August 2016	
Project site coordinator for both Korea and Japan sites/customers for the NXT1980 
System Maturity Project: Intro Support for implementing and managing agreed processes 
for the way of working and issues escalations for both site and system maturations.

May - June 2016			
Elected-Project Lead, for the initiation, planning, risk management, execution and closure 
of the NXT1980 Lens Swap (Upgrade) at Samsung Memory Korea.

March – December 2015		
Project team member in project teams for implementation of a generic kick-off & generic 
zero-error game-plan (ZRGP) templates for Improving the CS NPI Department Process 
Way of working for upgrades.

March – September 2015		
Project Lead, for design and implementation of a Generic Beta Test Specification (B-TPS) 
Template for Improving the CS NPI Department Process Way of working for upgrades.

January – December 2015		
Main Project coordinator and Issues escalation manager for the planning, execution and 
closure of multiple projects (LRL LS, IP2) with several ASML international customers.

January – December 2014		
Main Project coordinator and Issues escalation manager for the planning, execution and 
closure of multiple projects (ART, LCBCR, SMASH) with several ASML customers.

October 2011 – December 2013	
Main Project coordinator and Issues escalation manager for the planning, execution and 
closure of multiple projects (DEP, Yieldstar) with several ASML international customers.
profile_positions.title: Start-up Equipment Support (SES) Engineer (Project Coordinator for Customers' Site Support)

profile_positions.description: My task involves designing performance models in POOSL (Parallel Object Oriented Specification Language) for embedded control systems. The model predicts the timing performance for controllers (processors) used in such systems with the aim of helping software design engineers of such systems to minimize overall design time and make improvements to the actual system(s).
profile_positions.title: Model Design Engineer for Embedded Control System (Networks)

company.name: Technical University Eindhoven (and In connection with ASML) Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Designing Models for hardware-software (embedded control networks or ) systems. Model predicts (timing and other related) performance of actual control systems. The goal is to minimize system design time.
profile_positions.title: Postgraduate Design Engineer

company.name: PowerTech Computers, Sokoto and Nsukka, Nigeria

profile_positions.company: PowerTech Computers, Sokoto and Nsukka, Nigeria
profile_positions.description:
PTC is small computer firm founded by me.PTC offered the following services which I was involved either as a trainer or project manager:

(1) Training (with recognized certification by the Nigerian Cooperate Affairs Commission) on computer software packages for students, youth corpers, other company staff and other people. I was involved as a trainer mostly at the beginning and later moved to other areas.

(2) Training (with recognized certification by the Nigerian Cooperate Affairs Commission) on Computer (hardware and software) maintenance and troubleshooting for students and clients. I was greatly involved in this since I was also the lead Engineer.

(3) Maintenance and Upgrade services at clients' locations. My duty is to see to it that these maintenance and upgrades are carried out as required for the satisfaction of our clients. 

(4) Consultancy services on computer system installation, troubleshooting, maintenance and purchase, as well as other related services.
profile_positions.title: Founder, (Project) Manager and Trainer

profile_positions.description: My task was giving instruction on the subject of Introductory Technology to the students of Silame Secondary School. This was my primary assignment during my service year to my country.
profile_positions.title: Instructor

company.name: My Personal Services, UNN and Lagos -- Nigeria

profile_positions.company: My Personal Services, UNN and Lagos -- Nigeria
profile_positions.description: During my time as student at the University of Nigeria Nsukka (UNN) from 2000 to 2004, I was involved in personally giving assistance in form of lessons, tutorial and workshops to both students in UNN and in Lagos where I spent my holiday after school periods. This was to help and motivate students and other people who required extra coaching on various subjects like Physics, Mathematics, Electronic-related courses, computer related subjects etc. Sometimes it includes personal advice to these people.
profile_positions.title: Motivational Instructor
